modName: Lind's Grey Wizard Robes Revamp - Texture Replacer
summary: HD Retexture of the Grey Robes, 2048x2048 Robes and Hood. featuring lots of shading and details. The idea was to make the robes look like what a Moth Priest would wear. To me, the emissaries of such an ancient and important order would never wear something as simple as what the grey robes look by default, considering they have their HQ in Cyrodill
descriptionHtml:
[center]-----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]Description:[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------[/center]
[b]

This is a texture replacer for the Brown long robes (Male and Female) featuring 2048x2048 textures for both the robes and the hood
Installation: Simply Unzip and copy the Data folder in your Skyrim directory.
The .dds files should end up into Data/textures/clothes/monk

If you have skimpy meshes installed and want to use these robes, I suggest installing either exeter's or calientes' adaptation.

Also compatible with high poli meshes (why wouldn't they be, uh?).[/b]

Overwrite if asked.

For those of you who don't fancy Tumblr, [url=https://twitter.com/LindsRealm] I just made this.

[img]https://s24.postimg.org/qey3j9tp1/Twitter.png[/img][/url][url=http://lindsworkshop.tumblr.com/][/url][/center]

[center] -----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]More Informations:[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------

[img]http://s23.postimg.org/bwrachicb/Grey_Front.jpg[/img]

The Grey robes:
Say I ask you this question: Can you think of an NPC who wears Grey Robes by default?
You thought of Dexion, the arguably useful Moth Priest of the Dawnguard DLC, didn't you? Well, Dexion is a Moth Priest, so my association for this one was Grey Robes = Moth Priest.

Moth Priests are one of the most ancient orders in Skyrim, and the only one you encounter seems to have just got out of the shower (yes, more bathrobes jokes, I know.)

The idea was to make the robes look "Royal", to me, the emissaries of such an ancient and important order would never wear something as simple as what the grey robes look by default, considering they have their HQ in Cyrodill and they manage to wield rare weapons such as the Akaviri swords.

-----------------------------------------------------------
[b][size=4]Features over Vanilla[/size][/b]
-----------------------------------------------------------[/center]

2.0:

- Scrapped the previous version because it just wasn't up to par.
- Hood is now 2k.
- Overly decorated.
- Removed all vanilla stitches.
- Added my own stitches.
- Also, stitches.
- Changed and cleaned up the trimming, also the colour now matches the elder scrolls colour.
- Remade the belt.
- More shading.
- More saturated.
- Less worn-like.
- Darker than the previous version.
- Colour should now match some vanilla gear (i.e. looks good with grey Fine Clothes).
- Redecorated the hood.
- Adding in another line to make it look like i did more than i actually did.

1.0:

-Overall lighter color.
-A ton of shading.
-More cloth details
-Different, dual-layered sleeves with white trim on the borders.
-Rope brown belt.
-Light Grey decorations all over the robes.
-More detailed cloth pattern.
-Higher contrast, worn-like feeling.
-Multi-layered gown (3 layers).
-Gold-Brownish trim on the borders.
-General 3d effects (Only visual of course, no meshes were edited)
-More detailed wrinkles and folds (Again, it's only a visual effect)
-Details and decorations on hood
